channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Rescue efforts under way after Philippine ferry sinks, leaving 18 dead
item.description: Search and rescue operations continued on Tuesday for 10 people still missing after a passenger boat capsized off a southern Philippine province, with the death toll rising slightly to 18, the Philippine Coast Guard said. Captain Noemie Cayabyab, a spokesperson at the PCG, said the total number of

item.title: Mark Tully, BBC correspondent known as the 'voice of India,' dies at 90
item.description: Mark Tully, a longtime BBC correspondent who was widely known as the “voice of India” for his reporting on the South Asian nation, has died, the broadcaster said. He was 90. Tully died Sunday at a New Delhi hospital after a brief illness. Born in India's Kolkata city in 1935, Tu

item.title: India will establish world peace under Modi’s leadership: Minister Shekhawat
item.description: India’s Union Minister for Culture and Tourism Gajendra Singh Shekhawat stated that under the leadership of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, India is working to establish peace in the world by following the path of Buddha. Addressing the Second Global Buddhist Summit held in Bharat Manda

item.title: 10 dead, 80 missing after Indonesia landslide
item.description: Indonesian authorities resumed search-and-rescue efforts for 80 people missing after a landslide killed 10 in a residential area of West Java province. The landslide early on Saturday was triggered by heavy rains starting the day before, which the weather agency warned could continue for a week in

item.title: 4th BIMSTEC meeting on environment and climate change held in Thimphu
item.description: The fourth meeting of the BIMSTEC Joint Working Group on Environment and Climate Change (JWG-ECC) was held in Bhutanese capital Thimphu recently, emphasising regional cooperation and the mobilisation of climate finance. The two-day meeting was hosted by Bhutan, the lead country for the Environment

item.title: ASEAN won’t certify Myanmar election: Malaysia
item.description: The 11-member Association of Southeast Asian Nations will not send observers to army-ruled Myanmar's ongoing three-stage election and will therefore not certify the poll, Malaysia's foreign minister said. Speaking to parliament, Minister Mohamad Hasan also said ASEAN was hoping to finalise a code

item.title: Blast kills seven in Chinese run hotel in Kabul
item.description: An explosion tore through a Chinese-run restaurant in a hotel in a heavily guarded part of Afghanistan's capital on Monday, killing a Chinese national and six Afghans and injuring several others, including a child, officials said. The restaurant was in the commercial Shahr-e-Naw neighbourhood of K

item.title: Magnitude 6 earthquake strikes northwestern Kashmir
item.description: An earthquake of magnitude 6 struck northwestern Kashmir in Pakistan on Monday, the European Mediterranean Seismological Center (EMSC) said. The quake was at a depth of 35km (21.75 miles), the EMSC said.

item.title: Iran restores limited internet
item.description: Some citizens in Iran have been provided with access to the Internet after several days of nationwide blackout, the semi-official Mehr news agency reported on Saturday, without giving more details. Also on Saturday, the country restored short message service (SMS), reports Xinhua. Iran imposed se

item.title: Massive fire at Karachi shopping mall kills 3, injures 12
item.description: A large fire swept through Gul Plaza, a multistory shopping mall in Karachi late Saturday, killing at least three people and injuring around a dozen others, officials said. Firefighters and rescue teams rushed to the scene shortly after 10 p.m. local time. Most shop owners had already left or were

item.title: Khamenei calls Trump criminal for causing casualties, damage, slander on Iranians
item.description: Iran's supreme leader Ali Khamenei said on Saturday that Iran considers US President Donald Trump a "criminal" for inflicting casualties, damage, and slander on the Iranian people during the protests. "The latest anti-Iran sedition was different in that the US President personally became involved,

item.title: Taiwan says Chinese drone made 'provocative' flight over South China Sea island
item.description: A Chinese reconnaissance drone briefly flew over the Taiwan-controlled Pratas Islands at the top end of the South China Sea on Saturday, in what Taiwan's defence ministry called a "provocative and irresponsible" move. Democratically governed Taiwan, which China claims as its own territory, reports
